data.event: The fortress was established in 1492 during the reign of Ivan III of Moscow and was named after him.

Ivangorod was granted town privileges and administered as a Russian township under the Crown of Sweden (who conquered it in 1612 from boyar Teuvo Aminev) until 1649, when its burghers were ordered to remove to a Narva suburb.

Ivangorod was granted town privileges and administered as a Russian township under the Crown of Sweden (who conquered it in 1612 from boyar Teuvo Aminev) until 1649, when its burghers were ordered to remove to a Narva suburb.

event.title: 1617, the Treaty of Stolbovo was signed

data.event: In 1617, the Treaty of Stolbovo was signed between Russia and Sweden, which placed the area under the Swedish sovereignty.

event.title: reconquered it during the Great Northern War in 1704

data.event: Russia reconquered it during the Great Northern War in 1704.

event.title: was considered an administrative part of the town of Narva from 1649

data.event: Despite other changes in territory and sovereignty, Ivangorod was considered an administrative part of the town of Narva from 1649 until 1945.

event.title: 1780, Ivangorod, together with Narva, was included

data.event: In 1780, Ivangorod, together with Narva, was included into Narvsky Uyezd of St. Petersburg Governorate.

event.title: 1796, Narvsky Uyezd was abolished and merged

data.event: In 1796, Narvsky Uyezd was abolished and merged into Yamburgsky Uyezd.
